Title: Colophon
Medium: ink and pigments on laid paper
Inscriptions: [Transliteration] al-hamd li-Llāh 'alá al-tamām wa-'lá rasūlih wa-<ā>lih afdal al-salāh wa-al-salām /1/ 'alá yad afqar al-wará Khayr Allāh Jāwush zādah matta'anā Allāh /2/ bi-al-husná wa-ziyādah [sic] qad waqa'a al-farāgh min tahrīr hadhihi /3/ al-nuskhah al-sharīfah fī waqt al-duhá yawm al-jum'ah /4/ min awāsit Rajab al-murajjab li-sanat thal<ā>th /5/ wa-thalathīn wa-mi<'>ah wa-alf min /6/ hijrah [sic] al-nabawīyah /7/ m (= tamma) /8/
Description: This folio from Walters manuscript W.666 contains 1 of 2 colophons (fols. 21a and 62b); the first (in Turkish) gives a fuller name of the scribe; the second (in Arabic) gives the name of the scribe as Khayr Allah Jawush Zadah and the date of copying as Friday, mid Rajab 1133 AH/AD 1721.
Keywords: Islamic; Ottoman; Turkish; Book; Codex; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Original Binding; Turkey; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Atai (Uzbeki, died 1044 AH/AD 1634)
